title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 10
author: Various
snippet: The family which she had gone to visit lived in an unpretending mansionbeautifully situated on a ridge of rising ground, which stretches fromeast to west, nearly through the middle of what is now the Parish ofCarnbee.

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 17
author: Alexander Leighton
snippet: It happened, however, that aday or two previously to his leaving, a party of pleasure was planned forvisiting Kellie Law, near Carnbee, and Macduff's Cave, near Earlsferry.
